Fault controller¶

class PyDSS.pyControllers.Controllers.FaultController.FaultController(FaultObj, Settings, dssInstance, ElmObjectList, dssSolver)[source]¶

The class is used to induce faults on bus for dynamic simulation studies. Subclass of the PyDSS.pyControllers.pyControllerAbstract.ControllerAbstract abstract class.

Parameters

  • FaultObj (class:PyDSS.dssElement.dssElement) – A PyDSS.dssElement.dssElement object that wraps around an OpenDSS ‘Fault’ element

  • Settings (dict) – A dictionary that defines the settings for the faul controller.

  • dssInstance (opendssdirect instance) – An opendssdirect instance

  • ElmObjectList (dict) – Dictionary of all dssElement, dssBus and dssCircuit ojects

  • dssSolver (PyDSS.SolveMode) – An instance of one of the classes defined in PyDSS.SolveMode.

Raises

AssertionError if ‘FaultObj’ is not a wrapped OpenDSS Fault element

PV controller¶

class PyDSS.pyControllers.Controllers.PvController.PvController(PvObj, Settings, dssInstance, ElmObjectList, dssSolver)[source]¶

Implementation of smart control modes of modern inverter systems. Subclass of the PyDSS.pyControllers.pyControllerAbstract.ControllerAbstract abstract class.

Parameters

  • PvObj – A PyDSS.dssElement.dssElement object that wraps around an OpenDSS ‘PVSystem’ element

  • Settings (dict) – A dictionary that defines the settings for the PvController.

  • dssInstance (opendssdirect) – An opendssdirect instance

  • ElmObjectList (dict) – Dictionary of all dssElement, dssBus and dssCircuit objects

  • dssSolver (PyDSS.SolveMode) – An instance of one of the classed defined in PyDSS.SolveMode.

Raises

AssertionError if ‘PvObj’ is not a wrapped OpenDSS PVSystem element

CPFcontrol()[source]¶

Constant power factor implementation

CutoffControl()[source]¶

Over voltage trip implementation

VPFcontrol()[source]¶

Variable power factor control implementation

VVARcontrol()[source]¶

Volt / var control implementation

VWcontrol()[source]¶

Volt / Watt control implementation

Pv controller [Gen]¶

class PyDSS.pyControllers.Controllers.PvControllerGen.PvControllerGen(PvObj, Settings, dssInstance, ElmObjectList, dssSolver)[source]¶

Implementation of IEEE1547-2003 and IEEE1547-2018 voltage ride-through standards using the OpenDSS Generator model. Subclass of the PyDSS.pyControllers.pyControllerAbstract.ControllerAbstract abstract class.

Parameters

  • PvObj – A PyDSS.dssElement.dssElement object that wraps around an OpenDSS ‘Generator’ element

  • Settings (dict) – A dictionary that defines the settings for the PvController.

  • dssInstance (opendssdirect) – An opendssdirect instance

  • ElmObjectList (dict) – Dictionary of all dssElement, dssBus and dssCircuit objects

  • dssSolver (PyDSS.SolveMode) – An instance of one of the classed defined in PyDSS.SolveMode.

Raises

AssertionError if ‘PvObj’ is not a wrapped OpenDSS Generator element

Trip(uIn)[source]¶

Implementation of the IEEE1587-2003 voltage ride-through requirements for inverter systems

VoltageRideThrough(uIn)[source]¶

Implementation of the IEEE1587-2018 voltage ride-through requirements for inverter systems

Socket controller¶

class PyDSS.pyControllers.Controllers.SocketController.SocketController(ElmObject, Settings, dssInstance, ElmObjectList, dssSolver)[source]¶

Allows PyDSS object to inteface with external software using socket communication. Subclass of the PyDSS.pyControllers.pyControllerAbstract.ControllerAbstract abstract class.

Parameters

  • ElmObject – A PyDSS.dssElement.dssElement object that wraps around any OpenDSS element

  • Settings (dict) – A dictionary that defines the settings for the PvController.

  • dssInstance (opendssdirect) – An opendssdirect instance

  • ElmObjectList (dict) – Dictionary of all dssElement, dssBus and dssCircuit objects

  • dssSolver (PyDSS.SolveMode) – An instance of one of the classed defined in PyDSS.SolveMode.

Raises

socket.error if the connection fails

Storage controller¶

class PyDSS.pyControllers.Controllers.StorageController.StorageController(StorageObj, Settings, dssInstance, ElmObjectList, dssSolver)[source]¶

Numerous control implementation for a storage system from both behind-the-meter and front-of- meter applications. Subclass of the PyDSS.pyControllers.pyControllerAbstract.ControllerAbstract abstract class.

Parameters

  • StorageObj – A PyDSS.dssElement.dssElement object that wraps around an OpenDSS Storage element

  • Settings (dict) – A dictionary that defines the settings for the PvController.

  • dssInstance (opendssdirect) – An opendssdirect instance

  • ElmObjectList (dict) – Dictionary of all dssElement, dssBus and dssCircuit objects

  • dssSolver (PyDSS.SolveMode) – An instance of one of the classed defined in PyDSS.SolveMode.

Raises

AssertionError if ‘StorageObj’ is not a wrapped OpenDSS Storage element

CapacityFirmimgControl()[source]¶

Implementation of a capacity firming algorithm

ConstantPowerFactorControl()[source]¶

Implementation of a constant power factor algorithm. In all cases of reactive power support, active power will be prioritized over reactive power.

DemandCharge()[source]¶

Implementation of a demand charge controller for behind the meter applications

NonExportTimeTriggered()[source]¶

Implementation of a smart non-export controller. Makes use of TOU window to optimize charging

PeakShavingControl()[source]¶

Implementation of a peak shaving / base loading controller. Setting both peak shaving and base loading limits to zero will make the storage work in “SELF CONSUMPTION” mode

ScheduledControl()[source]¶

Implementation of a fixed schedule controller. Used to implemented predefined dispatch signals

TimeOfUse()[source]¶

Implementation of a time of use controller for behind the meter applications

TimeTriggeredControl()[source]¶

Charge and discharge cycles depend on defined time base schedules

VariablePowerFactorControl()[source]¶

Implementation of a variable power factor algorithm. In all cases of reactive power support, active power will be prioritized over reactive power.

VoltVarControl()[source]¶

Implementation of a Volt / var algorithm. Enables the storage to stack multiple services. In all cases of reactive power support, active power will be prioritized over reactive power.

Xfmr controller¶

class PyDSS.pyControllers.Controllers.xfmrController.xfmrController(RegulatorObj, Settings, dssInstance, ElmObjectList, dssSolver)[source]¶

The controller locks a regulator in the event of reverse power flow. Subclass of the PyDSS.pyControllers.pyControllerAbstract.ControllerAbstract abstract class.

Parameters

  • RegulatorObj – A PyDSS.dssElement.dssElement object that wraps around an OpenDSS ‘Regulator’ element

  • Settings (dict) – A dictionary that defines the settings for the PvController.

  • dssInstance (opendssdirect) – An opendssdirect instance

  • ElmObjectList (dict) – Dictionary of all dssElement, dssBus and dssCircuit objects

  • dssSolver (PyDSS.SolveMode) – An instance of one of the classed defined in PyDSS.SolveMode.

Raises

AssertionError if ‘RegulatorObj’ is not a wrapped OpenDSS Regulator element
